pullRequest.body:
We show that if a sub-basis is closed under finite intersections, then it is a basis for a topology.

As a corollary, if a sub-basis is closed under intersections, then inserting the universal set gives a basis for the topology.

An example application of this result is given in #12234

---

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

back for more in a bit.
Here are some simplifications for you.
I'm sure there must be a better argument, but I haven't been able to figure it out.

```suggestion
  inter_mem s hs t ht:= by
    obtain âŸ¨(rfl | hs), (rfl | ht)âŸ© := And.intro hs ht
    all_goals aesop
```

automation is your friend. Let it do the heavy lifting. Also, you really want to familiarize yourself with the `rintro` and `obtain` tactics, especially the `rfl` syntax. They can simplify so much. `lift` is also very handy.
```suggestion
  convert isTopologicalBasis_of_subbasis hsg
  refine le_antisymm (fun t ht â†¦ âŸ¨{t}, by simpa using htâŸ©) ?_
  rintro _ âŸ¨g, âŸ¨hg, hgsâŸ©, rflâŸ©
  lift g to Finset (Set Î±) using hg
  exact hsi.finiteInter_mem g hgs
```

Just extract the lemma and the `simp` lemma here (of course, put it in the appropriate place):
```lean
lemma generateFrom_insert_of_generateOpen {Î± : Type*} {s : Set (Set Î±)} {t : Set Î±}
    (ht : GenerateOpen s t) : generateFrom (insert t s) = generateFrom s := by
  refine le_antisymm (generateFrom_anti <| subset_insert t s) (le_generateFrom ?_)
  rintro t (rfl | h)
  Â· exact ht
  Â· exact isOpen_generateFrom_of_mem h

@[simp]
lemma generateFrom_insert_univ {Î± : Type*} {s : Set (Set Î±)} :
    generateFrom (insert univ s) = generateFrom s :=
  generateFrom_insert_of_generateOpen .univ
```
And then this proof becomes:
```suggestion
    (hsi : âˆ€ â¦ƒsâ¦„, s âˆˆ r â†’ âˆ€ â¦ƒtâ¦„, t âˆˆ r â†’ s âˆ© t âˆˆ r) : IsTopologicalBasis (insert univ r) :=
  isTopologicalBasis_of_subbasis_of_finiteInter (by simpa using hsg) (FiniteInter.mkâ‚‚ hsi)
```
I assume the correct place for the lemmas is in `Topology/Order`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Mathlib/Topology/Bases): subbasis closed under intersection is a basis

source.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(Topology/Order/LowerUpperTopology): Scott and Upper topologies coincide on a complete linear order
